history.content: I don't know about the workload of data 100, but physics 7A is relatively light (3-4 hours of homework per week at most) and CS70 is notoriously tough. Since you're CS-intended, I would be cautious about taking too difficult a workload because 70 problem sets take up a large amount of time. CS70, R1B, physics 7A, and Data100 should be manageable if you have a good work ethic though.

children.subject: This seems like a fine course-load to me. CS70 seems to be you're only major time - consuming class tbh.

history.content:
I'm a CS-intended first-year, but I'm considering doing a minor in GIS and likely want to go to graduate school in engineering (civil systems). These programs require a year of university physics. I'm also really into data science/ML though. I've already taken math 53/54 and 61A, and am taking 61B this summer

I'm definitely going to take cs70 and R1B in the fall, but I need to pick 2/3 between Physics 7A, Geography 80 (first class for GIS minor), and Data/stat 100. 

I think the combo of CS70, R1B, physics, and Data100 would accomplish the most, but I'm worried that it would be too heavy of a workload. 

any advice would be so appreciated
history.subject: Course advice: CS70, Physics 7A, DS100, R1B, Geography 80
